newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Dec 26.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Dec 26.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Thursday:

* Indonesia's capital market supervisory agency (Bapepam) issued a new regulation allowing firms planning to list on the stock exchanges to disseminate information to prospective investors before they obtain a statement of official acknowledgement from the agency.
* The Dow Jones industrial average rose 33.83 points to 6,522.85 on very light volume on Tuesday as investors scooped up big-name stocks and before rushing off to celebrate Christmas.

* The Jakarta Composite Index was down 0.33 points, or 0.05 percent, to close at 632.74 points on continued profit taking on Tuesday amid weak market sentiment as brokers wound down ahead of the Christmas holiday.
* On Thursday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,362.25/62.90 in early trading against the opening of 2,362.00/63.00.
* Bimantara after an announcement the conglomerate had increased its stake in PT Nestle Indonesia to 19.95 percent from 13.72 percent.
* Textile manufacturer Karwell Indonesia on an announcement it had linked-up with another firm PT Ladang Kreasi Dwiperkasa to boost sales.
* Trading firm Rimba Niaga Idola on an announcement it had indefinitely postponed plans to acquire privately-owned PT Transco Multisindo as well as make a rights issue.
* Footwear manufacturer Telagamas Pertiwi on an announcement it planned to buy a 100 percent stake worth 40.5 billion rupiah in distribution firm Artha Graha Wahana.
